Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 10:57. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault has occurred on an underground electricity cable affecting the local area, we may have to dig up the road to carry out repairs.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV UG Network Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this, but we are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 04:15 - We can now confirm that all power in the Heath Close area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground fault, which our engineers made repairs to.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 03:16 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us repairs are proving more difficult than anticipated.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 02:00 and 03:00 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Luke at 02:38.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 12:11. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 12:03. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  Our engineers have attended the fault, and have made an emergency repair to restore power to as many premises as possible.  It is our intention to return to make a permanent repair as soon as we can.  I'm sorry, but we can't give you a time for this at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 13:41 - We're pleased to report that all power in the Abbey Road area should now be restored. The local council sent out their electrician due to a water leak and following their safety checks, our engineers have connected a temporary generator. This will be providing your power while the council electrician completes internal work within the block of flats.

Depending on what the issue is, it may take a few days for their repairs to be carried out, but once this is completed safely, the generator can be removed and network power will be resumed.

If you'd like any further information, or if your power is not restored, please call us any time on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 18:08. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.

Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 06:14 -  Hi David here. I'm sorry for how long the power was off especially on this festive period. Thank you for your patience while our engineers continue works on the underground network in the Westcliff Drive area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so David, Stuart, Decasta and Adam are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 05:50 - Our engineers are are still on site working on repairs and are still aiming to complete work and restore power between 06:30 and 07:30.

We're sorry for the disruption this power cut will be causing, especially the impact it will be having on the start to your day. If you have any concerns about this please do not hesitate to contact our Customer Services team any time.

We will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 02:17 - Thanks for your patience over tonight.

Our engineers have let us know that they have a lot of work to do. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 06:00 and 07:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Luke at 01:39.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Luke at 00:18 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We had to turn off power in your area so our engineers could safely carry out emergency repairs to the network.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 03:13 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 3374 customers in the West Malling, ME19 5 area, by diverting power around the overhead fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 02:28. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Luke at 03:13 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 3374 customers in the West Malling, ME19 5 area, by diverting power around the overhead fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 07:39 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1333 customers in the SW18 5 area by diverting power around the underground network fault. We're pleased that we have been able to restore power sooner than we estimated.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, especially over the holidays, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Engineers have arrived on site in the SW18 5 area to investigate an underground cabling fault currently affecting 70 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 08:00-09:00, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We'll continue to update you with all of our progress.

Sent by Decasta at 07:25.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 06:38. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Engineers have arrived on site in the SW18 5 area to investigate an underground cabling fault currently affecting 70 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive on site to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Theo at 15:10.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Theo, Aaron and Lisa are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 13:21 - Our engineers have investigated and found that the power is off due to a fault on our underground electricity network which has affected our substation equipment, so we're sending a specialist team to pinpoint the fault and dig down to expose the cabling for repairs.

Considering the work that may be required, the revised estimated time to have the power back on is between 18:30-19:30.

We're sorry to change the time, but we'll keep you updated with our progress. If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always here to talk on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 13:09 - Hi David here again. I'm sorry for how long you were off power for especially on Boxing Day. We can now confirm that all power in the Claremont Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:35 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Claremont Road area, the estimated time of 15:00-16:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by David at 12:25.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 11:22. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.

Steps.Name: Power back on

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Claremont Road area, the estimated time of 15:00-16:00 hasn't changed.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can.

We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by David at 12:25.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 11:27. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on
